systemprompt-gmail.usageInstructions: Set GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS and GOOGLE_TOKEN environment variables, then run with npx

systemprompt-interview.name: Systemprompt MCP Interview Server
systemprompt-interview.description: MCP server for AI-powered interview roleplay scenarios with real-time feedback and customizable interview scenarios
systemprompt-interview.usageInstructions: Connect the MCP server in systemprompt.io console, add CV, configure interview, and activate agent

sketchfab.name: Sketchfab MCP Server
sketchfab.description: A microservice for interacting with the Sketchfab API using MCP
sketchfab.usageInstructions: Create a Sketchfab account, obtain your API token, and run with 'env SKETCHFAB_API_TOKEN=your_token uvx sketchfab-mcp'

cloudflare-github-backup.name: Cloudflare to GitHub Backup MCP Server
cloudflare-github-backup.description: An MCP server that backs up Cloudflare projects to a GitHub repository.
cloudflare-github-backup.usageInstructions: Start the MCP server by restarting the VS Code extension, then use the 'use_mcp_tool' tool to call the 'backup_projects' tool.

huntress.name: Huntress API MCP Server
huntress.description: An MCP server providing programmatic access to Huntress API functionality including account management, organization management, and incident reports.
huntress.usageInstructions: Configure MCP settings with server command and environment variables, then use available tools like get_account_info, list_organizations, and list_agents.

pocketbase.name: Advanced PocketBase MCP Server
pocketbase.description: A comprehensive MCP server for advanced PocketBase database operations and schema management
pocketbase.usageInstructions: Deploy using Cloudflare Workers or traditional Node.js server, configure environment variables as needed

alphavantagemcpserver.name: Alphavantage MCP Server
alphavantagemcpserver.description: MCP server for Alphavantage stock market data API

docswrite.name: Docswrite MCP Server
docswrite.description: Server providing tools for Google Docs, Google Drive, and WordPress integration through Docswrite
docswrite.usageInstructions: Run the server with your Docswrite token: node dist/index.js --docswriteToken=your-docswrite-token

apple.name: Apple MCP Server
apple.description: Apple-native tools for the MCP protocol, enabling interactions with Apple apps like Messages, Notes, Contacts, and more
apple.usageInstructions: Ask Claude to use the apple-mcp tool with commands like 'send a message to John Doe' or 'create a reminder to Buy groceries for tomorrow at 5pm'

automated-bod-25-01-cisa-microsoft-polic.name: CISA M365 MCP Server
automated-bod-25-01-cisa-microsoft-polic.description: MCP server implementing CISA BOD25-01 security controls for Microsoft365
automated-bod-25-01-cisa-microsoft-polic.usageInstructions: Use tools like block_legacy_auth, enforce_phishing_resistant_mfa, configure_global_admins, get_policy_status

paypal.name: PayPal MCP Server
paypal.description: MCP server providing integration with PayPal's APIs for payment processing, invoicing, and business management
paypal.usageInstructions: Use MCP client to call tools like create_order, create_invoice, create_payout

netlify.name: Netlify MCP Server
netlify.description: MCP server providing comprehensive access to Netlify CLI features through MCP SDK.
netlify.usageInstructions: Run with 'npx @DynamicEndpoints/Netlify-MCP-Server' and configure using environment variables.

meta.name: Meta MCP Server
meta.description: An MCP server that generates customized MCP servers with dynamic file management and error handling.
meta.usageInstructions: Configure in Claude Desktop using the provided command and args, or run using 'npx -y meta-mcp-server'

3d-printer.name: MCP 3D Printer Server
3d-printer.description: An MCP server for connecting Claude with various 3D printer management systems
3d-printer.usageInstructions: Run the server using 'npx mcp-3d-printer-server', configure environment variables as needed

schemaflow.name: SchemaFlow MCP Server
schemaflow.description: Provides real-time access to PostgreSQL and Supabase database schemas through Model Context Protocol for AI-IDEs.
schemaflow.usageInstructions: Configure in AI-IDE settings using provided URL and token from SchemaFlow dashboard

canvas-lms.name: Canvas MCP Server
canvas-lms.description: A comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Canvas LMS with complete student, instructor, and account administration functionality
canvas-lms.usageInstructions: Configure environment variables CANVAS_API_TOKEN and CANVAS_DOMAIN, then run 'canvas-mcp-server'

hal.name: HAL (HTTP API Layer)
hal.description: MCP server providing HTTP API capabilities to Large Language Models with secure secret management and OpenAPI/Swagger integration
hal.usageInstructions: Start the HAL server with 'npx hal-mcp' or configure it with environment variables for Swagger/OpenAPI integration and secret management

coresignal.name: Coresignal MCP Server
coresignal.description: Enables integration of Coresignal's B2B data with AI-powered applications
coresignal.usageInstructions: Connect to https://mcp.coresignal.com/sse using mcp-remote with API key

time-local.name: Time MCP Server
time-local.description: A Model Context Protocol server providing time and timezone conversion capabilities

openai-websearch.name: OpenAI WebSearch MCP Server
openai-websearch.description: MCP server providing OpenAI websearch functionality for AI assistants
openai-websearch.usageInstructions: Configure with Claude or Zed settings, providing OPENAI_API_KEY

chronulus.name: Chronulus MCP Server
chronulus.description: MCP Server for Chronulus AI Forecasting & Prediction Agents
chronulus.usageInstructions: Configure Claude desktop client with Chronulus MCP Server

ebaymcpserver.name: Ebay MCP Server
ebaymcpserver.description: Simple Ebay server for fetching auctions from Ebay.com
ebaymcpserver.usageInstructions: Use prompts like 'Find me 10 auctions for batman comics'

codealive.name: CodeAlive MCP Server
codealive.description: MCP server providing enriched context from codebases for AI clients
codealive.usageInstructions: Configure AI clients like Claude Desktop or VS Code with GitHub Copilot to use CodeAlive MCP

keycloak-model-context-protocol.name: Keycloak MCP Server
keycloak-model-context-protocol.description: A Model Context Protocol server for Keycloak administration, providing tools to manage users and realms.
keycloak-model-context-protocol.usageInstructions: Configure the server in your Claude Desktop configuration file with required environment variables and use available tools like create-user, delete-user, list-realms, and list-users.

blog.name: MCP Blog Upload Service
blog.description: Automatically copies and processes Markdown files from Obsidian to a specified directory and pushes changes to GitHub
blog.usageInstructions: Trigger with 'blog+article name' to copy and process the specified Markdown file

python-jira.name: Python Jira MCP Server
python-jira.description: An MCP server implementation in Python that integrates with Jira API, allowing AI models to interact with Jira through a standardized protocol.
python-jira.usageInstructions: Run 'python main.py' to start the server, then configure the MCP server path in Cursor to point to 'main.py'

memorymesh.name: MemoryMesh
memorymesh.description: A knowledge graph server for AI models, particularly suited for text-based RPGs and interactive storytelling.
memorymesh.usageInstructions: Place schema files in dist/data/schemas directory and use the SchemaManager tool for creation and editing.

obsidian-jsoncanvas.name: JSON Canvas MCP Server
obsidian-jsoncanvas.description: MCP server for creating, modifying, and validating JSON Canvas files according to the official specification.
obsidian-jsoncanvas.usageInstructions: Configure OUTPUT_PATH and FORMAT as needed, then use the provided Python API to create and manipulate canvases.

outlook-email.name: Email Processing MCP Server
outlook-email.description: MCP server for processing Outlook emails with MongoDB integration for semantic search and SQLite storage
outlook-email.installCommand: uv pip install -e . && uv pip install fastmcp
outlook-email.usageInstructions: Configure environment variables, activate virtual environment, and add server configuration to Claude for Desktop config file

prometheus.name: Prometheus MCP Server
prometheus.description: An MCP server for retrieving and analyzing data from Prometheus databases, enabling LLMs to invoke tool functions for metric data retrieval and analysis.
prometheus.usageInstructions: Set PROMETHEUS_HOST environment variable and run using 'uv --directory /path/to/prometheus_mcp_server run server.py'

maigret.name: Maigret MCP Server
maigret.description: An MCP server for maigret, a powerful OSINT tool that collects user account information from various public sources
maigret.usageInstructions: Use the search_username or parse_url tools with required parameters, optionally specifying output format and site filters

virustotal.name: VirusTotal MCP Server
virustotal.description: An MCP server for querying VirusTotal API, providing comprehensive security analysis tools
virustotal.usageInstructions: Install via Smithery or manually using npm, then configure Claude Desktop

cursor.name: Cursor MCP - Claude Desktop Integration
cursor.description: MCP implementation for seamless integration between Claude AI and desktop applications through Cursor IDE
cursor.usageInstructions: Create .env file with DEFAULT_WORKSPACE_PATH, add to Claude's MCP configuration, and start server with 'mcp-cursor'

watch.name: Server Watch MCP
watch.description: A CLI wrapper that monitors command output and exposes it as an MCP server, useful for development workflows and log monitoring
watch.usageInstructions: Start the server with 'server-watch-mcp <command>', then use MCP tools like 'get_logs' and 'search_logs' in Claude

shodan.name: Shodan MCP Server
shodan.description: An MCP server for querying Shodan API and CVEDB, providing network intelligence and security services
shodan.usageInstructions: Install via Smithery or manually using npm, then configure Claude Desktop with the server details

bracketbot.name: Multi-Robot Control MCP Agent
bracketbot.description: MCP server for controlling multiple robots via FastAPI servers
bracketbot.usageInstructions: Start FastAPI robot control servers on different ports, Claude desktop client automatically runs MCP server

summarization-functions.name: Summarization Functions
summarization-functions.description: An MCP server providing intelligent text summarization capabilities for AI workflows
summarization-functions.usageInstructions: Add the server to your MCP configuration file with required environment variables

gauntlet-incept.name: Gauntlet-Incept MCP Server
gauntlet-incept.description: MCP server for generating educational content for K-8 students
gauntlet-incept.usageInstructions: Run 'npm run mcp' to start the MCP server

code-explainer.name: Code Explainer MCP
code-explainer.description: A Cloudflare Worker that analyzes and explains code with comprehensive breakdowns of structure and functionality.
code-explainer.usageInstructions: Send a POST request to your worker URL with a JSON body containing the method 'explainCode' and code to analyze.

memory-custom.name: Memory Custom MCP Server
memory-custom.description: A customized memory server for managing knowledge graphs with features like custom memory paths and timestamping
memory-custom.usageInstructions: Configure MEMORY_FILE_PATH, then run 'npm run build' followed by 'node dist/index.js' to start the server

python-docs.name: Python Docs Server
python-docs.description: An MCP server that fetches Python documentation using the Brave Search API
python-docs.usageInstructions: Add server config to Claude Desktop configuration file

pushover.name: Pushover MCP
pushover.description: An MCP server for sending notifications via Pushover.net
pushover.usageInstructions: Configure the MCP server with your Pushover token and user key, then use the 'send' tool to send notifications

database-updater.name: Database Updater MCP Server
database-updater.description: An MCP server for updating databases from CSV and Excel files, supporting multiple database types.
database-updater.usageInstructions: Use the `update_database` tool with required parameters: filePath, databaseType, connectionString, and tableName.

command.name: MCP Command Server
command.description: A secure Model Context Protocol server for executing system commands through LLM applications
command.usageInstructions: Configure allowed commands by setting ALLOWED_COMMANDS environment variable, then integrate with Claude Desktop

clojars.name: Clojars MCP Server
clojars.description: An MCP server providing tools for fetching Clojars dependency information
clojars.usageInstructions: Run 'npx clojars-deps-server' to start the server, then configure in Claude settings

agentops.name: AgentOps MCP Server
agentops.description: Provides access to observability and tracing data for debugging complex AI agent runs.
agentops.usageInstructions: Add agentops-mcp to your MCP configuration file with your AgentOps API key

browser-tools.name: BrowserTools MCP
browser-tools.description: A powerful browser monitoring and interaction tool for AI-powered applications via Anthropic's Model Context Protocol
browser-tools.usageInstructions: Install Chrome extension, run 'npx @agentdeskai/browser-tools-mcp@latest' in IDE, and 'npx @agentdeskai/browser-tools-server@latest' in new terminal

nostr.name: Nostr MCP Server
nostr.description: MCP server enabling AI models to interact with Nostr protocol
nostr.usageInstructions: npm start or npm run dev for development mode

lightning.name: Lightning Network MCP Server
lightning.description: An MCP server enabling AI models to interact with Lightning Network and pay invoices
lightning.usageInstructions: Start the server using 'npm run dev' for development mode or 'npm start' for production mode

truerag.name: TrueRAG GraphQL Policies API MCP Server
truerag.description: MCP server implementation for GraphQL API providing access to policies
truerag.usageInstructions: Add to MCP Client like Claude Desktop by configuring claude_desktop_config.json

bitcoin.name: itcoin & Lightning Network MCP Server
bitcoin.description: An MCP server enabling AI models to interact with Bitcoin and Lightning Network for key generation, address validation, transaction decoding, and blockchain queries.
bitcoin.usageInstructions: Configure in Claude Desktop by adding 'bitcoin-mcp': { 'command': 'npx', 'args': ['-y', 'bitcoin-mcp@latest'] } in claude_desktop_config.json under 'mcpServers'

db.name: Database MCP Server
db.description: MCP server for querying multiple database systems including PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite

multi-service.name: Multi-Service MCP Server
multi-service.description: A modular server implementing the Model Context Protocol standard for various tools
multi-service.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/AdamPippert/multi-service-mcp-server.git && cd mcp-server && pip install -r requirements.txt && npm install
multi-service.usageInstructions: Start the server using 'python app.py' after installation and configuration

terminal-use.name: MCP Terminal Use
terminal-use.description: An MCP server providing terminal access to specified directories
terminal-use.usageInstructions: Configure ALLOWED_DIRECTORY environment variable and add server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json

mcpnotes.name: MCP Notes Server
mcpnotes.description: A simple note-taking application built on the MCP protocol for AI-driven note management
mcpnotes.usageInstructions: Run 'npx -p mcp-notes mcp-notes-web-server --dynamodb dynamodb://access_key:secret_key@region/table' and navigate to http://localhost:3100

activitywatch.name: ActivityWatch MCP Server
activitywatch.description: An MCP server connecting to ActivityWatch for time tracking data interaction
activitywatch.usageInstructions: Configure in Claude for Desktop config file, then restart Claude

qwen.name: Qwen Max MCP Server
qwen.description: MCP server implementation for Qwen Max language model, providing text generation with configurable parameters.
qwen.usageInstructions: Configure Claude Desktop to use the server, then call the 'qwen_max' tool with prompt and optional parameters.

etherscan.name: Etherscan Tools MCP Server
etherscan.description: MCP server providing Ethereum blockchain data through Etherscan's API, including balance checking, transaction history, and ENS resolution.
etherscan.usageInstructions: Start the server using 'npm start', then configure in Claude Desktop through Settings > MCP Servers > Add Server

veri5ight.name: Veri5ight
veri5ight.description: An MCP server providing direct interface between Claude and Ethereum nodes for real-time token info and smart contract data.
veri5ight.usageInstructions: Run 'npm run build' then configure Claude Desktop to use the server by pointing to the compiled index.js file.

make-integration-issue.name: Make MCP Server
make-integration-issue.description: MCP server for Make integration with Claude Desktop

markdown2pdf.name: Markdown2PDF MCP Server
markdown2pdf.description: MCP server for converting Markdown documents to PDF files with syntax highlighting and custom styling
markdown2pdf.usageInstructions: Start server with 'npm start', then use 'create_pdf_from_markdown' tool with required 'markdown' parameter

record-to-markdown.name: Record to Markdown/Apple Notes
record-to-markdown.description: Records Claude conversation to markdown or Apple notes
record-to-markdown.installCommand: pip install uv && git clone https://github.com/29decibel/record-to-markdown && cd record-to-markdown && uv sync
record-to-markdown.usageInstructions: After installation, configure Claude desktop with: 'uv --directory /FULL_PATH_TO/record-to-markdown run server.py'

mcpexec.name: MCPExec
mcpexec.description: MCP server to execute local CLI commands
mcpexec.usageInstructions: Set up uv, create a Python project, install dependencies, and configure MCP server

taskwarrior.name: Taskwarrior MCP Server
taskwarrior.description: An MCP server for managing tasks in Taskwarrior, providing tools to add, update, delete, and list tasks.
taskwarrior.usageInstructions: Use with an MCP client like Cursor, Goose, or Claude by specifying the path to the tasks.ts file.
